website_summaries.verdict: Reasonably priced, well-made, loud turkey call to attract toms.
pros: The shaker call is easy to use and very loud
can be used with one or two hands for different effects
good for calling or challenging male turkeys
silencer cap prevents unwanted noise when hunting
cons: Larger than some other turkey calls

customer_reviews.title: Here's what it sounds like
customer_reviews.text: Here's what it sounds like. Seems realistic. Will write another review after spring hunting season.
customer_reviews.author: Christina S.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the attention of Turkeys!  Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what I was expecting. We have a group of wild yard turkeys that I feed and I have tried in vain to gobble with them so I was hoping this might work. Once I learned how to use it I tried it. One male looked and me and did gooble but mostly they could see right through me that I was not one of them. It seems it would get a response from wild turkeys in the woods but I am not a hunter. It is fun though!
customer_reviews.author: Sally B.

customer_reviews.title: Top Turkey caller and great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Of all the callers I have accumulated here in the NorCal woods, this has been the most popular with guests and turkeys alike. Though it has been mistaken for an "adult toy". If you want to have some real fun slip it into a friend's carry on baggage next time they go to the airport.
customer_reviews.author: artSF

customer_reviews.title: Very realistic
customer_reviews.text: Some friends and myself go out Turkey hunting together. This call sounds very realistic compared to other calls I've used. So much so if be very careful using it while hunting public when other hunters are around. Great for locating
customer_reviews.author: Colten

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a real gobbler
customer_reviews.text: Field tested and legit! Sounds like a real gobbler. You can control the call loudness pretty easily. One change I would make is the plastic cap to close it down. A rubber one with a rubber connector would be awesome. But, so far, mine is still on after 5 hunts. Love Primos brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t leave it within pet reach!
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out as soon as we got it...then one of our pit puppies got ahold of it. The cap was gone in 3 seconds and where you hold it had indentions where here teeth were, but other than that - it held up really well against her sharp teeth. Just bought another one.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Davis

customer_reviews.title: Put out the call and make em fall!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome call. Come right over the top of them with this call and listen to the sound of a pissed off tom headed in your direction. Bonus: I keep a spare one at the house for when my wife starts nagging and I just come right over the top of her with this call, the kids think it’s hilarious and it really gets her angry, but in a funny way.
customer_reviews.author: HoustonNative

customer_reviews.title: Well made, lots of fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this "caller"... mainly just for the sound one can make... youthful or old gobblers. I replaced an old caller w/ this one, and am very happy. The instructions are better than I had before. I used to use this to drive my dog nuts for a minute or too. She'd bark, I'd gobble, she'd bark, I'd gobble... then I'd quit, and of course, doggy got a treat. Well made, lots of fun!!
customer_reviews.author: W. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Takes very little skill to gobble...
customer_reviews.text: Easy way to sound like a gobbler... down side is that it's a bit bulky and for me the rubber accordion was a bit loose (so dry here in Arizona?) that I had to specifically hold on to the rubber while shaking.
customer_reviews.author: likesgoodthingsthatwork

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it works great
customer_reviews.text: Since I’ve been turkey hunting this will be the third gobble callthat I purchased is the first time with a Primo gobble call but I put it through the test and it’s a great tool to have in your arsenal
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Best gobble out there!
customer_reviews.text: This call sounds the best out of the gobble calls I have. Can't wait for the spring. Bring on the thunder chickens!
customer_reviews.author: Southeast VA

customer_reviews.title: One of the best gobble tubes on the market
customer_reviews.text: One of the best gobble tubes on the market! Well-constructed. Sounds good enough to full the wariest toms and is pretty loud compared to some other leading gobble tubes. The cap on the bottom keeps the gobbler from going off when it's in your pack. For this cheap price even if it breaks on you eventually, you can purchase another one. Good sounding call. Nice and loud. Durable. Everything a gobble tube should be.
customer_reviews.author: Abishai

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Sounds Great. Really makes turkey verbal at times. It is kind of large and the top rubber piece will slip off of you don't hold it while using. You may want to rubber band it down.
customer_reviews.author: Ben from Seaside

customer_reviews.title: Use as a Last Resort in Turkey Hunting
customer_reviews.text: Always good to have one in your back pack when turkey hunting. Easy to use and makes a convincing Jake or Tom call. But use it only as a last resort because you could become the target of another hunter.
customer_reviews.author: AndyS.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound.
customer_reviews.text: Used in conjunction with an old Black Magic aluminum striker call to take a 22 1/2 pound 3 year-old gobbler last April. A little jake music adds to the deception. The "safety" cap is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Pappy348

customer_reviews.title: Nice call!
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it’ll last! Sounds very realistic my husband can do a jake sound and also get a true gobbler sound from it but mine is a weaker, slower shake so it sounds more like a jake, which is exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these before but lost it. I liked it so much I bought the same exact one. Really gets them stirred up in the morning, coming off roost.
customer_reviews.author: VOLFAN

customer_reviews.title: What a call!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for an avid hunter. They said it was a great product and loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy McMurtry

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: loved it - used it a bunch......til it fell out of my pocket in some thick brush when i was chasing a gobbler......gosh darn it it was so thick in there we couldn't find it when I had my husband go back and help me look for it....... gonna have to get a new one cuz this thing was easy to use and worked perfectly....nothing like talking back and forth with the turkeys...
customer_reviews.author: jenn

customer_reviews.title: mainly by sounding like another gobbler which challenges the peck order of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Most years I take three gobblers in Illinois, mainly by sounding like another gobbler which challenges the peck order of the toms. While I've got several different gobble tubes, the Primos seems to produce the best gobbles as evidenced by the real birds. All you have to do is shake it.
customer_reviews.author: blink5

customer_reviews.title: Just as described and good price
customer_reviews.text: Read the back of the package and seems easy to use, hope I am making the right noise. Will find out and get back to you about use after Turkey season. Love the Primos Limited Life time Warranty.
customer_reviews.author: R. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: great Gobblee Call
customer_reviews.text: This call has a rich deep sound. I have owned this call for over 10 years and mine recently broke while hunting. I purchased these in hope that they were still the same as my old call. These did not disappoint at all. The exact same call with the same durable sound I have had for years. Highly reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Would gobbble with this then Yelp back, and go quit. Three Tom's would gobble and I wouldn't respond. Wait then gobble and Yelp quick. Man did it make those three Tom's mad and got em to come in from a 200 yards away in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: SJT1212

customer_reviews.title: Okay call
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay call. Doesn't sound exactly like a gobbler. May trick a turkey from a long distance. Ended up using a box call instead.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter 63069

customer_reviews.title: Nice gobbler, but I'm still hungry over here
customer_reviews.text: GOBBLE GOBBLE!!! Sounds relatively authentic. Went out three times at the end of the season with this device, didn't see anything. I actually attracted a few horny bucks with this thing. I think there may be some cross-breeding in the backwoods of Tennessee going on. Who knows.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great Gobbler call
customer_reviews.text: Great Gobbler call. Have used it for a couple years. Then lost it in the woods one day. Had to get me another one. I think this is the best call to talk to birds when they are still in the roost. Have been very successful with them on the ground as well. I would recommend this product to anyone looking to talk to a big thunder chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Very realistic sounds
customer_reviews.text: Super fun to use. It sounds very realistic. It makes my dogs go crazy.
customer_reviews.author: reggen

customer_reviews.title: Too realistic... almost
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gobbler ! If you want to sound like a hen just do the two hand option for a more annoyed hen response, be careful using the gobbler sound because it sounds so real I had a couple hunters calling back to me in the woods before ! Watch out for buckshot! Lol
customer_reviews.author: kim K.

customer_reviews.title: surprising
customer_reviews.text: this call actually sounds really good. better than my previous gobble tube. I can't wait to try it on a tom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Funny and functional
customer_reviews.text: Works. I actually bought as a gag gift so I can’t state to the durability or longevity but it works as described!
customer_reviews.author: Bekah

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly!!! The Turkeys now wonder around my yard a few feet away not scared but curious who this new Turkey is!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I had ne and it tore after a few (>6 or 7 years). This one is OK and it is still a hit with the kids during Thanksgiving.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great Call
customer_reviews.text: I've used this call for many years as a locator call. Works great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Worst call ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst call ever. I think primo or amazon knows this is junk. They told me not to even send it back to them. I still threw it out. POS!
customer_reviews.author: AA-Ron

customer_reviews.title: Shake it like a Polaroid
customer_reviews.text: I've heard many shock gobbles while using the Gobbler Shaker Call. Quickly switch to box or mouth call once Tom was located. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rusty0811

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great getting that far off Tom to respond thinking another bird has his hens.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: The best thing was that it gave my 6 yr old ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this in the third week of the season after birds were shy to calling. The best thing was that it gave my 6 yr old something to do and it was easy for him to use. I was calling and every so often he would shake this call. We called a big Tom in within 30 yds and it made his day. Great product and a lot of fun for my son! I don't know if this could be used outside of a ground blind though. It can take a considerable amount of movement to get the sound right.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Bowden

customer_reviews.title: 🦃🦃
customer_reviews.text: Bought for hubby!! Scored a TOM the first weekend we used it !
customer_reviews.author: CLM

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Came with instructions, cant wait to use it for turkey season here
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: This is a large call and it is very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a large call and it is very easy to use. However, don't think you will be using it one handed discretely. Looks like you are madly trying to whip a herd of cattle into action in one hand mode. Much easier to remain concealed and minimize movement by using the two handed method.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Must have call
customer_reviews.text: Good call, there are a lot out there but this is an effective and cost efficient call.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok, takes a lot of practice to get it right
customer_reviews.author: firegator26

customer_reviews.title: Gobble gobble!
customer_reviews.text: As a novice hunter, I would not head out without this one. I harvested my first Tom last spring within 2 hours of being out. Called the bird to within 15 feet. Had to switch to a reed after a while, but this loud shaker got that Tom all fired up!
customer_reviews.author: Rthill

customer_reviews.title: Fairly realistic
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty surprised by the sound quality of this call, just give it a few shakes from side to side and it produces a fairly realistic turkey gobbling. Only real downside is the amount of movement needed to generate sound, definitely try to use this only if you know the you are out of the turkey's line of site.
customer_reviews.author: That one guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well. Where I work there are wild turkeys all over and I thought it would just be fun to call them over when I’m bored. I’m excited to use this!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa sherriff

customer_reviews.title: I love it when they do that!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the blind and I hear some tom go gobble, gobble. I love it when they do that! Because I tell them HEY I got some hens over here and YOU don't come check it out! If you are taking your girlfriend turkey hunting show her the utube video on how to use this turkey call
customer_reviews.author: Kim Roe

customer_reviews.title: It Makes Turkeys Gobble in Response
customer_reviews.text: I personally wish it was louder, but the turkeys in my area seem to like it well enough. I have used it a few times to bring in Toms that wouldn't come for a hen call. It's also insanely easy to use. Just practice with it before hand so that you actually sound like a turkey when you get in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great for Thanksgiving!
customer_reviews.text: I first saw (heard ) theses Gobbler Calls at my local Trader Joe's last year the day before Thanksgiving. Some of the staff used these along with very funny Turkey headdresses - it was hilarious - sounded just like turkeys were running around the store! I purchased several along with the Turkey hats for our grand kids to use this year.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Remington

customer_reviews.title: I think it sounds great, and the first turkey I came across responded ...
customer_reviews.text: I think it sounds great, and the first turkey I came across responded very well. Once I was set up for hunting, I didn't get another reply to the gobble, but had responses to a slate and a box call. I'm kind of a novice turkey hunter, so I'm not sure it was the call.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gallogly

customer_reviews.title: Works better then expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these 2018 turkey season great locator cal
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Same quality that you get buying from any ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Same quality that you get buying from any other sporting goods store.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time making a very believable gobble with it. Not a lot of volume either
customer_reviews.author: Jay L.

customer_reviews.title: Gobble call
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a locater call. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is a great prop....
customer_reviews.text: It works great on Turkey and is a great prop when we have company. I put it on the nightstand next to my wife's side of the bed. Our guests usually put their jackets in there and it gets quite a hilarious reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: you're pretty much hosed
customer_reviews.text: They work on fired up Tom's but they dry out and crack. I'm on my 2nd. If this happens again I won't buy a 3rd. Unlike a mouth diaphragm it's not convenient to store this call in a few drops of water so once the inside diaphragm dries you, you're pretty much hosed.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Lefemine

customer_reviews.title: works great. Been messing with the Tom's outside the gate ...
customer_reviews.text: works great. Been messing with the Tom's outside the gate at work, and they react to it every time. This weekend, we'll be putting it to the ultimate test. Will update later.
customer_reviews.author: ICeMAnAbk

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Be careful where you use it but it's responsible for a couple if dead gobblers this year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good if you can make it work
customer_reviews.text: This call is difficult to use effectively. After some practice, my 15-year-old can turn out some decent gobbles; I'm about 50/50. I won't use it in the field for fear of scaring off the birds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for bowling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for when my league gets a turkey in bowling and it is so easy to use and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Calvert

customer_reviews.title: ... for this new style but I think I will like it.
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting use to for this new style but I think I will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Hobby Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like sick gobbler. That’s been shot
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what this supose to sound like def left at lodge
customer_reviews.author: Dale K.

customer_reviews.title: easy and realistic
customer_reviews.text: Very well packaged although blister pack some what difficult to open and keep use instructions in tact. Easy to use as shaker. Accordion effect may take a little experimenting to get the hang of maybe about 10 minutes or so. Very realistic sound of a jake and a mature tom.
customer_reviews.author: S. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Tukey Celebration!
customer_reviews.text: I only buy my turkey in a store. This was for our bowling league to celebrate rolling a turkey. Everybody loves it!
customer_reviews.author: James Schlesselman

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product for hunters or wild life enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for hunters or wild life enthusiast. Fun to call in the turkeys. I had it in my car when a turkey crossed in front of me. I gave it a couple of shakes and back out he came.
customer_reviews.author: althea3679

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me and will use next season
customer_reviews.text: Took this out and called in a Tom easy to figure out how to use
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but not to sure about using it where the ...
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great but not to sure about using it where the gobblers can see it. Gave it to my kids to play with and they call turkeys into the back yard all the time with it
customer_reviews.author: Jrcairtime

customer_reviews.title: Handy for inexperienced callers
customer_reviews.text: If you are an inexperienced caller this is very handy and pretty foolproof. It is great for talking to birds further out and i had them gobbling right back. Since i have turkeys all the time at my bird feeder it was easy to practice right from my front porch.
customer_reviews.author: R. Denley

customer_reviews.title: I had this exact same call years ago and loved it. It works well
customer_reviews.text: I had this exact same call years ago and loved it. It works well, sounds good, and is better than the current more expensive Primos gobble call. I would recommend this call.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Decent product for price.
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars due to an unbeatable price, takes some practice to get a realistic sound and requires quite a bit of movement. Works best for locating and drawing in turkeys from a distance, once in sight I've been switching to a slate call.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M.

customer_reviews.title: sounds like a turkey with bronchitis
customer_reviews.text: it sounds like a turkey with bronchitis. i plan to return it. dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: tim1234567890

customer_reviews.title: Good for the beginner.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to use, although you have to make a lot of movement to shake it. Use it as a locator inside a blind or all the movement will likely scare them off...
customer_reviews.author: PWsFinest

customer_reviews.title: Looks silly- works great!
customer_reviews.text: It may look a little silly, but it works. I had both hens and toms respond to this, and even fooled some veteran hunters who heard it from a considerable distance!
customer_reviews.author: Matt D

customer_reviews.title: Worked but still didnt get my turkey!
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out yesterday while Spring turkey hunting. Hadn't gone in years, never used a caller. Worked fine, called in a couple of hens, unfortunately only can hunt males in Spring. But - it did work, and easily too, used one hand.
customer_reviews.author: hiking hippie

customer_reviews.title: People will make fun of you, until they hear it
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit this sounds good, but i feel like a total idiot using it. I would prefer if the cap had a longer string or something on it so i could hold it, it does flop around quite a bit in use.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Takes some pratice getting use to how to make a ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes some pratice getting use to how to make a true gobble. But they work, this is my second one as my first one was lost in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Ended up not needing it, but seems good.
customer_reviews.text: Fine product. Works easily enough. Unfortunately you can't actually USE turkey calls in california, much to my chagrin, but the product seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: LogicJab

customer_reviews.title: Good call.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for hunting. He liked it but didn't love it. He still uses it though. Said it was a great call. It is very loud too and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Nita Holl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sounds, easy to use, multi functions. Excited to try it while hunting
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Maraisa

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't sound any better than the other shake tubes I've tried and I don't think any sound good
customer_reviews.author: Urban Legend

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This one at least produces something similar to a gobbler sound
customer_reviews.author: ManukaHoneyMGO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Is as advertised, grandson even got his first turkey .
customer_reviews.author: J. Noble

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I give this a zero opened it shook it and fell apart
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: has great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought another one for my boys to use this year. My older one, 5-6 yrs old, has great sound quality. However, it appears Primos changed the shaker part at least. I would not recommend this gobble call anymore as the sound quality is not good.
customer_reviews.author: PeDe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool can't wait to take it turkey hunting thank u
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Clark boyd jr

customer_reviews.title: Well built product
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use! I have it clipped to a lanyard that I wear around my neck while hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Joao M. Aguiar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, learn and implement. The call has a nice weight to it and doesn't appear to be cheaply made. Hope to pull in some gobblers this Spring season coming up next week.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great call for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use call at a great price. Sure it's not as accurate as a mouth call or a box call. But it its killed two toms two years in a row.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome call to get Tom's fired up
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome call to get Tom's fired up. They come looking for a fight. When using a slate call then this gobbler. A Tom think another bird is trying to steal his girlfriend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a jake that is squished between two mattresses
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work very well in cooler weather. Sounds like a jake that is squished between two mattresses. Very muffled
customer_reviews.author: ZionSparky

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't really sound like a turkey. Can't get the sound I want out of this.
customer_reviews.author: Swish33

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product and have thoroughly enjoyed it. I have been able to harvest turkeys with it.
customer_reviews.author: antonio

customer_reviews.title: Good gobbler
customer_reviews.text: Definitely gets them to gobble back and wander towards you.
customer_reviews.author: TheCastro

customer_reviews.title: Works great and looks funky too
customer_reviews.text: Great comedy routine for the golf course! ....wait til your buddy is on his back swing and gobble away! Tons of laughs.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kidd

customer_reviews.title: used in spring turkey hunt
customer_reviews.text: Read previous reviews and was the reason I bought this turkry call. Used it on spring turkey hunt and works like a charm. Was able to call the birds within range and take em down. Only wish was smsller in size.
customer_reviews.author: Richard F. Rogina

customer_reviews.title: Works great! If they are near you will get a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great ! If they are near you will get a response !
customer_reviews.author: walter f reaster

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a turkey
customer_reviews.text: I just started playing with it, but it seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but a bit bulky
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to use as product details make out to be. Also a bit bulky to be carrying around in your turkey vest all day.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Murphy

customer_reviews.title: The real gobbler!!!
customer_reviews.text: This can sound like a real old gobbler or a jake. I will never leave home without it. I highly recommend this call.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCord

customer_reviews.title: Sounds pretty good. I was actually impressed with how close ...
customer_reviews.text: Sounds pretty good. I was actually impressed with how close it sounded to an actual Tom. Shot my trophy turkey 6 hours before it showed up in my mail box so ill use it next year.
customer_reviews.author: Sam's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for a New hunter
customer_reviews.text: We have a 10 year old boy ready for his first turkey hunt this year, and the mouth calls were too difficult. This was perfect. He was able to make sounds that attracted turkeys right to his little blind.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy Ella

product_meta.title: Primos Hunting PS222 The Gobbler Turkey Shaker Call, Black
product_meta.description:
Primos has been trusted by individuals for decades. Products that are made of quality material and designed to withstand the toughest environments. Trust the Brand that others in the field use and don't settle for less. Quality materials used for all primos products 100 percent designed and tested for the toughest situations and environments Whether you are a professional, recreational user, or even casual, primos will fit the mold for all types of people.

AMAZON.COM
Built for ease of use, the Gobbler Shaker Call from Primos allows you to create jake gobbling with one hand and adult gobbling with two hands. The loud shaker provides sounds that will both challenge and locate gobblers. A patented silencer cap eliminates unintended sounds.
feature_bullets: Super loud and easy to use
Patented silencer cap eliminates untimely sounds while moving through the woods; A great safety feature
One-handed operation for Jake gobbling or two-handed for mature gobbling
Loud and easy to use shaker turkey call
Patented silencer cap eliminates untimely sounds
Designed for challenging or locating gobblers
